citation.article-title: Rubritepida flocculans gen. nov., sp. nov., a new slightly thermophilic member of the α-1 subclass of the Proteobacteria.

p.s: Description of Rubritepida flocculans sp. nov.
Rubritepida flocculans (flo´ccu. lans, N. L. adj. part. flocculans, flocculating, pertaining to the organism’s trait to flocculate in liquid cultures)
Rubritepida flocculans forms very short rod-shaped cells 1.4 to 1.7 μm in length by 0.7 to 1.2 μm in width.
The cells are motile by one polar flagellum.
Colonies on medium R3 are red pigmented.
The optimum growth temperature is about 50 °C, growth does not occur at 55 °C; the optimum pH is between 7.5 and 8.0.
Bacteriochloropyll a was only detected after growth at 30 °C, but not after growth at 50 °C.
The predominant fatty acids are 16:0 and 18:1 ω7c; 19:0 2OH cyclo 11,12 is also present.
Growth does not occur under anaerobic conditions in the dark or in the light.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.

D-glucose, L-sorbose, L-arabinose, D-ribose, D-xylose, D-melibiose, glycerol, lactate, glycerate, pyruvate, α-ketoglutarate, fumarate, malate, L-cysteine, Lglutamate, L-alanine and L-serine serve as carbon sources.
The mole G+C ratio of the DNA is 70.2 mol%.
This bacterium was isolated from the hot spring at Egerszalók in Hungary.

Strain H-8T has been deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen, Braunschweig, Germany as strain DSM 14296 and in the American Type Culture Collection, Manassas, USA as strain ATCC BAA-385.
